did.abstract: Letters and papers of Benjamin Burroughs and his overseer, John George, concerning the sale of horses, furniture, tools, livestock, and enslaved people as well as improvements at Cold Spring Plantation. Included also is a letter, 1847, from Theodore S. Fay in Berlin, commenting on his travels in Europe.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters and papers of Benjamin Burroughs and his overseer, John George, concerning the sale of horses, furniture, tools, livestock, and enslaved people as well as improvements at Cold Spring Plantation. Included also is a letter, 1847, from Theodore S. Fay in Berlin, commenting on his travels in Europe.
